result.execSummary:
The defendant Rhoda J Stahmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Operate Firearm w/ Controlled Substance, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(bm).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order and Amendment to Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases - extends probation for 12 months or until completion. Court obligations to be paid within 10 months and if not paid defendant to serve 2 months conditional jail time.
Order and Amendment to Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases
Balance Inquiry
Agent Brandee Morris appeared via video.

9:19 a.m. Defendant present in court via telephone and without counsel.  Agent Brandee Morris present in court via video. Court goes over obligations due.  Defendnat concurs, still owes the obligations but sent a payment in. Court questions defendant why she hasn't paid. Statement by defendant. Court questions defendant re: completion of assessment  Statement by defendant, has completed that. Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year or until conditions / obligations are completed and paid off.  Court grants the defendant 10 months to pay in full or pay as much as she can, and if not paid in full, defendant is to spend 60 days in jail. 

Court adjourned at 9:24 a.m.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely
Probation review hearing on May 11, 2020 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
10:28 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - have a resolution on these cases.  ADA recites agreement -  defendant will plea to Count 1 & 3 on 2016CF46; Count 1 & 5 on 2015CF87 and count 1 on 2016CF28 and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Zamzow concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as repeater.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 3 as charged on 2016CF46 and orders counts 2 & 4 be dismissed and read-in; finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 5 as charged on 2015CF87 and orders counts 2,3 & 4 be dismissed and read-in and finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged on 2016CF28 and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Zamzow.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2016CF46

Count 1 - SWD and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

Count 3 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-AODA and any follow-up.
-Count 1 - 20 days county jail, stayed and to be used at the agent's discretion for disciplinary purposes.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-DNA Sample

2015CF87

Count 1 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

Count 5 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-AODA and any follow-up.
-Count 1 - 20 days county jail, with huber and to commence immediately.
-Count 5 - 10 days county jail, with huber and consecutive to count 1.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-DNA Sample

2016CF28

Count 1 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS: 

-Court costs.
-AODA and any follow-up.
-Count 1 - 10 days county jail, stayed and is to be used at the agent's discretion for disciplinary purposes.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-DNA Sample.

Court grants sentence credit if revoked, and is to be determined by the jail.
Court orders the $500.00 cash bond on file be applied to the court costs in that case first and any balance, it is to be applied to the other cases.

Statement by ADA regarding length of probation on misdemeanors - should be one year.  Statement by the Court - confirms that it should be one year.
